name: Expo Fixes
text:
Here are a few steps that may help resolve the issue:

üîß Upgrade to SDK 53 (Recommended)
SDK 53 has significantly fewer dependency issues compared to SDK 52.

Run this command in the terminal (code > terminal) to upgrade:

npx expo install expo@^53.0.0 && npx @bycedric/expo-install --fix


üõ†Ô∏è Resolve Dependency Conflicts

Create an .npmrc file to allow legacy peer dependencies:

echo
 
"legacy-peer-deps=true"
 
>> 
.npmrc


This helps bypass strict dependency resolution that can cause build failures.


üßπ Clear Cached Files

Sometimes cached modules can cause unexpected behavior. Try removing them:

rm package-lock.json

rm
 
-rf 
node_modules/


Then reinstall:

npm install

üåê Environment-Specific Dependencies

Some Expo packages include native modules that don‚Äôt work in web environments.
When using Bolt, make sure the ai understands which dependencies are platform-specific.
You can guide it by explicitly stating the target environment (iOS vs. web) when generating or editing code.


üì± Use Expo Go for Quick Testing

If you haven‚Äôt already, try testing your app using Expo Go ‚Äî it‚Äôs a fast way to preview your app on a real device without a full build.

If these steps don‚Äôt resolve the issue, feel free to send over your package.json and any recent changes you made before the crash started.
We‚Äôll dig deeper and help get you back on track.

We‚Äôd love to see you back on the platform, and we‚Äôre here to support you however we can.
